repnme.cdata!:
Honduras - Additional Financing for
            Nutrition and Social Protection Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Nutrition and Social Protection
            Project for the Republic of Honduras had an overall
            moderately satisfactory outcome with the performances of the
            Bank and the borrower being deemed to be moderately
            satisfactory as well. Of the three project development
            objective indicators, one was achieved fully, one was
            achieved to a large extent, and the third was achieved
            partially. Of the nineteen intermediate outcome indicators,
            one was not achieved, one dropped during restructuring, two
            achieved, five partially achieved, and ten surpassed the
            target. Significant lessons learned during the
            implementation of the project are: 1) implementing projects
            with more than one executing agency is complex; 2)
            monitoring and evaluation of project activities is critical
            to identify the project's achievements and demonstrate
            a country's commitment; 3) consistency in procurement
            guidance is key to avoid bottlenecks in implementation; and
            4) sharing best practices designed and piloted with World
            Bank support to promote sustainability is important.

repnme.cdata!:
Honduras - Nutrition and Social Protection
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Nutrition and Social Protection Project s is to improve
            Honduras' social safety net for children and youth by:
            (i) strengthening the recipient's capacity to
            administer social assistance programs; (ii) improving
            nutritional and health status of young children by expanding
            the Atencion Integral a la Ninez Comunitaria (AIN-C)
            program, and (iii) increasing employability of at-risk youth
            by piloting a first employment program. This restructuring
            paper proposes a level II restructuring of the Honduras
            Nutrition and Social Protection Project additional Financing
            to: (i) modify the service provider and training scheme for
            the First Employment Program (FEP); (ii) revise one
            intermediate outcome indicator target to reflect those
            changes; and (iii) change one disbursement category to
            facilitate disbursement under components. The changes
            reflects a request from Ministry of Labor and Social
            Security (SOLSS), the implementing agency for the project,
            to change the implementing arrangements for components The
            change will affect the training scheme arrangements and one
            associated indicator for components, as well as disbursement
            arrangements for components.
